samples.name: Traditional Khuang Drum
samples.description: Authentic recording of a Mizo Khuang drum, a traditional percussion instrument central to Mizo cultural performances

culturalContext.significance: The Khuang is the most important drum in Mizo culture, used in all major festivals and ceremonies
culturalContext.usageGuidelines: Respectful use in cultural contexts encouraged. Not to be used in ways that mock or diminish Mizo culture.

samples.name: Tuibur Bamboo Flute Melody
samples.description: Soulful melody played on the traditional Mizo bamboo flute, capturing the essence of Mizo folk music

culturalContext.significance: The Tuibur represents the connection between the Mizo people and nature, often played during harvest celebrations
culturalContext.usageGuidelines: Ideal for peaceful, reflective content. Please maintain the spiritual essence of the instrument.

samples.name: Darbu Gong Ensemble
samples.description: Traditional Mizo gong ensemble featuring the metallic resonance of Darbu, used in celebrations and rituals

culturalContext.significance: Darbu gongs are played during important life events and community celebrations, symbolizing unity and joy
culturalContext.usageGuidelines: Perfect for celebratory content. Honor the communal spirit this instrument represents.
